Entries.default: "Larro? Damn that boy if he's in trouble."

"Madiccho, where is that spoiled brat?" 

A woman in fine clothes clutches a ledger in both hands. She searches the faces of passers-by, settling on yours with an uncertain frown.
"What seems to be the problem?"
"Larro has returned to the estate intact. Belfetto." Nera loosens her grip on her ledger.
"Larro is gone, claimed before his time by Valera aggression!" Nera clutches her ledger over her heart.
"Farewell."
"Are you all right?"
"Larro is past due for a company meeting. Mother wants me to drag the elusive louse back by his ear." She tucks the book under her arm.
"Could I persuade you to watch out for Larro? I'd pay generously for your trouble."
"If I happen across Larro, I'll let you know."
"What did you mean by 'Valera rat'?"
"I... I'm concerned because Larro tends to feud with Orso, one of the local Valera rats."
"Would you? I'll be waiting at the estate in case he happens to return." Nera thumbs over her shoulder.
"The Valeras... a brood of sea vermin playing at nobility." She hefts her ledger as if to bring it down on a pest.
"I just hope Larro doesn't bring ridicule to the Bardatto name."
"You've brought us peace in a difficult time. Thank you."
"Mother speaks highly of you. Her trust is not easy to earn."
"Madiccho. You have brought enough pain to this family."
"I'm trying to be the responsible one in the family, and it's a heavy burden."
"You aren't exactly tearing the district apart looking for him."
"Eccosi, I only manage the family business!" She takes up her ledger with both hands, holding it like a shield.
"Larro and his miscreant friends carouse at the tavern, the falls above the adra mill, and the southwestern bridge."
"I take it your mother is someone important."
"Ezzali Bardatto. The Vailian Trading Company leans on her to finance their mission."
"If only more of her offspring were as accomplished." Nera raises her free hand and squeezes the bridge of her nose.
"He will be missed, I'm sure."
"One less thing for the families to duel over."
[Say nothing.]
"Tell Larro to stay out of trouble."
"I didn't do it for charity, you know?"
[Say nothing.]
"Gellarde if you can take encouragement from this, for I cannot."
"Here, for your discretion." She passes you a pouch of coins and adds a short mark to her ledger before snapping it shut.
"Poor, stupid Larro..."
"Our family can't go on like this."
"Where is my postenago of a brother?"
"You there - have you seen Larro Bardatto?"
"We squabble and compete, but Larro... the postenago takes it too far."
"Wish I could help you, but I can't. Farewell."
Nera shifts her attention from you and looks out at passers-by for any sympathetic ear. Sighing, she turns away.
"If you see him, tell Larro to get his good-for-nothing ass back home."
"If you see him, tell Larro to get his good-for-nothing ass back home."
"There can be no peace while civilized kith turn on each other." She turns her gaze away in thoughtful silence.
[Study her hands.]
Nera has been digging her nails into her ledger, leaving crescent moon-shaped impressions in the binding. She notices your interest and holds the book protectively close.
"You'd think this district was a maze, the way he manages to hide." She glances over your shoulder and sighs, then looks back at you with sudden recognition.
"I trust the whispers of Queen's Berth, so I trust you."
"If you desire to get in the graces of the Vailian Trading Company, we can help each other."
"As long as the Vailian Trading Company recognizes my usefulness, we can call it a deal."
"Ac, consider it done." She flips open the ledger and hastily scribbles in a column, licking the nib of her quill.
"Too much Bardatto blood has been spilled in the name of vengiatta."
"You have not met mother, have you?" Nera thumbs her chin, leaving a spot of ink behind.
"You did not happen to hear the commotion behind the adra mill?" Her grip squeezes tighter, eliciting a crack from the binding of her ledger.
"I stained the falls red."
[Lie] "I heard nothing. Perhaps it was the sea."
[Say nothing.]
"I suppose it's time to expect the worst for my idiot brother." Nera lets the weight of the ledger draw her arms down. She doesn't seem aware of it.
"I wish I shared your confidence. Larro should have returned by now."
Nera lets the ledger fall from her hands. It hits the ground with a loud slap.

"Larro wasn't the only Bardatto who could wield a sword!"

Whistling to alert the household, Nera draws her weapon and advances.
"How can I help?"
"What sort of clout do you have with the trading company?"
"I'm sure he'll turn up on his own."
"Mother's bank commands the wealth of the Deadfire campaign." Nera absently pats the cover of her ledger.
"Ac. Something tells me this is more than just tardiness." Her fingers dig into the spine of the book.
"I get the feeling that there's still some unfinished business."
"Ac. Nothing has been solved, only delayed."
This young woman looks you up and down, her mouth set in a hard line. She clutches a ledger protectively.
"I don't know you, stranger, but sientere for Larro's tantrum." She gestures toward the door, equally frustrated and relieved.
"You find us in a time of mourning. My brother Larro..." The weight of the ledger slowly drags down her posture.
"Must be nice to be a layabout. Uncle Angbert would've tanned my hide."
"Ac. I am angry and jealous in equal measure."
"Of course... mestra." Pallegina's jaw flexes under a forced smile.
"Well we do have this thing with chasing a rogue god to the ends of Eora. But I guess if it's on the way."

"Sérre Pallegina, have you time to lend your hand?" 

Nera's heels click together as she inclines her head in a polite bow.
"I always have time to help the great families of the Republics, though I must admit this seems a bit... pedestrian."
"If you only knew my brother, Sérre! He goes not a day without causing trouble."
"I'm certain she'll have work for someone invested in the family."
"There." She snaps the book shut.
"Better to ask why Larro isn't sprinting back to look after his birthright."
"You people place a high premium on influence."
"Ac, the true coin of the realm."
"Ekera, I can think of several reasons."
"Kindly keep them to yourself."
"Ac, a face from the motherland is a welcome sight."
"The spirit magnet? Sientere that I did not recognize you."
